sentences: Lapsed jätavad oma kodud mööda maailma reisima.
Mees jättis tööd ja asus ettevõtjaks.
context: The word 'jättis' is the past tense third person singular form of the verb 'jätta', which means to leave, abandon, quit, or give up something. In Estonian grammar, this shows action completed in the past by a single male subject or mixed group ending in masculine gender marker. It commonly refers to leaving school (kooli jätma), abandoning one's home, quitting a job, or giving up on an activity.
